alert.note: Alert for Admiralty Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 23 at 5:59AM AKST until January 23 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...SNOW AND FREEZING RAIN CONTINUE ACROSS THE NORTHERN PANHANDLE THROUGH TUESDAY... .Snowfall continues across the northern panhandle with some pockets of freezing rain moving north through the daytime and evening on Tuesday as warmer air starts to arrive. Over the inner channels near Juneau, snow has started to become wetter but temperatures have remained cold enough to stay as snow. Precipitation rates will significantly diminish beginning Wednesday morning. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM AKST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Wet snow and freezing rain. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches, ice accumulations of a light glaze. * WHERE...Angoon. * WHEN...Until 3 PM AKST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures will warm through the day.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. People are urged to prepare their property before the onset of winter weather.
